dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eTL;DR\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eBundles \u003ca href=\"https://www.2ality.com/2014/09/es6-modules-final.html\" rel=\"nofollow\"\u003eES Modules\u003c/a\u003e, \u003ca href=\"http://wiki.commonjs.org/\" rel=\"nofollow\"\u003eCommonJS\u003c/a\u003e, and \u003ca href=\"https://github.com/amdjs/amdjs-api/wiki/AMD\"\u003eAMD\u003c/a\u003e modules (even combined).\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eCan create a single bundle or multiple chunks that are asynchronously loaded at runtime (to reduce initial loading time).\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eDependencies are resolved during compilation, reducing the runtime size.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eLoaders can preprocess files while compiling, e.g. TypeScript to JavaScript, Handlebars strings to compiled functions, images to Base64, etc.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eHighly modular plugin system to do whatever else your application requires.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"markdown-heading\" dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ch3 tabindex=\"-1\" class=\"heading-element\" to start, you can \u003cstrong\u003ealways\u003c/strong\u003e reach out to \u003ca href=\"https://twitter.com/thelarkinn\" rel=\"nofollow\"\u003eSean Larkin (@TheLarkInn) on Twitter\u003c/a\u003e or simply submit an issue and a maintainer can help give you guidance!\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eWe have also started a series on our \u003ca href=\"https://medium.com/webpack\" rel=\"nofollow\"\u003eMedium Publication\u003c/a\u003e called \u003ca href=\"https://medium.com/webpack/contributors-guide/home\" rel=\"nofollow\"\u003eThe Contributor's Guide to webpack\u003c/a\u003e. We welcome you to read it and post any questions or responses if you still need help.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003cem\u003eLooking to speak about webpack?\u003c/em\u003e We'd \u003cstrong\u003elove\u003c/strong\u003e to review your talk abstract/CFP! You can email it to webpack [at] opencollective [dot] com and we can give pointers or tips!!!\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"markdown-heading\" dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ch3 align=\"center\" tabindex=\"-1\" class=\"heading-element\" dir=\"auto\"\u003eCreating your own plugins and loaders\u003c/h3\u003e\u003ca id=\"user-content-creating-your-own-plugins-and-loaders\" class=\"anchor-element\" aria-label=\"Permalink: Creating your own plugins and loaders\" href=\"#creating-your-own-plugins-and-loaders\"\u003e\u003csvg class=\"octicon octicon-link\" viewBox=\"0 0 16 16\" version=\"1.1\" width=\"16\" height=\"16\" aria-hidden=\"true\"\u003e\u003cpath d=\"m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z\"\u003e\u003c/path\u003e\u003c/svg\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eIf you create a loader or plugin, we would \u0026lt;3 for you to open source it, and put it on npm. We follow the \u003ccode\u003ex-loader\u003c/code\u003e, \u003ccode\u003ex-webpack-plugin\u003c/code\u003e naming convention.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"markdown-heading\" dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ch2 align=\"center\" tabindex=\"-1\" class=\"heading-element\" dir=\"auto\"\u003eSupport\u003c/h2\u003e\u003ca id=\"user-content-support\" class=\"anchor-element\" aria-label=\"Permalink: Support\" href=\"#support\"\u003e\u003csvg class=\"octicon octicon-link\" viewBox=\"0 0 16 16\" version=\"1.1\" width=\"16\" height=\"16\" aria-hidden=\"true\"\u003e\u003cpath d=\"m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z\"\u003e\u003c/path\u003e\u003c/svg\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eWe consider webpack to be a low-level tool used not only individually but also layered beneath other awesome tools. Because of its flexibility, webpack isn't always the \u003cem\u003eeasiest\u003c/em\u003e entry-level solution, however we do believe it is the most powerful. That said, we're always looking for ways to improve and simplify the tool without compromising functionality. If you have any ideas on ways to accomplish this, we're all ears!\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eIf you're just getting started, take a look at \u003ca href=\"https://webpack.js.org/concepts/\" rel=\"nofollow\"\u003eour new docs and concepts page\u003c/a\u003e. This has a high level overview that is great for beginners!!\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eLooking for webpack 1 docs? Please check out the old \u003ca href=\"https://github.com/webpack/docs/wiki/contents\"\u003ewiki\u003c/a\u003e, but note that this deprecated version is no longer supported.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eIf you want to discuss something or just need help, \u003ca href=\"https://gitter.im/webpack/webpack\" rel=\"nofollow\"\u003ehere is our Gitter room\u003c/a\u003e where there are always individuals looking to help out!\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eIf you are still having difficulty, we would love for you to post\na question to \u003ca href=\"https://stackoverflow.com/tags/webpack\" rel=\"nofollow\"\u003eStackOverflow with the webpack tag\u003c/a\u003e. It is much easier to answer questions that include your webpack.config.js and relevant files! So if you can provide them, we'd be extremely grateful (and more likely to help you find the answer!)\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eIf you are twitter savvy you can tweet #webpack with your question and someone should be able to reach out and help also.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eIf you have discovered a 🐜 or have a feature suggestion, feel free to create an issue on dir=\"auto\"\u003eMost of the core team members, webpack contributors and contributors in the ecosystem do this open source work in their free time. If you use webpack for a serious task, and you'd like us to invest more time on it, please donate. This project increases your income/productivity too. It makes development and applications faster and it reduces the required bandwidth.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eThis is how we use the donations:\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div><p dir="auto">Webpack is a bundler for modules. The main purpose is to bundle JavaScriptfiles for usage in a browser, yet it is also capable of transforming, bundling,or packaging just about any resource or asset.</p><p dir="auto"><strong>TL;DR</strong></p><ul dir="auto"><li>Bundles <a href="https://www.2ality.com/2014/09/es6-modules-final.html" rel="nofollow">ES Modules</a>, <a href="http://wiki.commonjs.org/" rel="nofollow">CommonJS</a>, and <a href="https://github.com/amdjs/amdjs-api/wiki/AMD">AMD</a> modules (even combined).</li><li>Can create a single bundle or multiple chunks that are asynchronously loaded at runtime (to reduce initial loading time).</li><li>Dependencies are resolved during compilation, reducing the runtime size.</li><li>Loaders can preprocess files while compiling, e.g. TypeScript to JavaScript, Handlebars strings to compiled functions, images to Base64, etc.</li><li>Highly modular plugin system to do whatever else your application requires.</li></ul><div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h3 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">Performance</h3><a id="user-content-performance" class="anchor-element" aria-label="Permalink: Performance" href="#performance"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div><p dir="auto">Webpack uses async I/O and has multiple caching levels. This makes webpack fastand incredibly <strong>fast</strong> on incremental compilations.</p><div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h3 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">Module Formats</h3><a id="user-content-module-formats" class="anchor-element" aria-label="Permalink: Module Formats" href="#module-formats"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div><p dir="auto">Webpack supports ES2015+, CommonJS and AMD modules <strong>out of the box</strong>. It performs clever staticanalysis on the AST of your code. It even has an evaluation engine to evaluatesimple expressions. This allows you to <strong>support most existing libraries</strong> out of the box.</p><div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h3 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto"><a href="https://webpack.js.org/guides/code-splitting/" rel="nofollow">Code Splitting</a></h3><a id="user-content-code-splitting" class="anchor-element" aria-label="Permalink: Code Splitting" href="#code-splitting"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div><p dir="auto">Webpack allows you to split your codebase into multiple chunks. Chunks areloaded asynchronously at runtime. This reduces the initial loading time.</p><div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h3 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto"><a href="https://webpack.js.org/guides/production-build/" rel="nofollow">Optimizations</a></h3><a id="user-content-optimizations" class="anchor-element" aria-label="Permalink: Optimizations" href="#optimizations"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div><p dir="auto">Webpack can do many optimizations to <strong>reduce the output size of yourJavaScript</strong> by deduplicating frequently used modules, minifying, and givingyou full control of what is loaded initially and what is loaded at runtimethrough code splitting. It can also make your code chunks <strong>cachefriendly</strong> by using hashes.</p><div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h2 align="center" tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">Contributing</h2><a id="user-content-contributing" class="anchor-element" aria-label="Permalink: Contributing" href="#contributing"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div><p dir="auto"><strong>We want contributing to webpack to be fun, enjoyable, and educational for anyone, and everyone.</strong> We have a <a href="https://medium.com/webpack/contributors-guide/home" rel="nofollow">vibrant ecosystem</a> that spans beyond this single repo. We welcome you to check out any of the repositories in <a href="https://github.com/webpack">our organization</a> or <a href="https://github.com/webpack-contrib">webpack-contrib organization</a> which houses all of our loaders and plugins.</p><p dir="auto">Contributions go far beyond pull requests and commits. Although we love giving you the opportunity to put your stamp on webpack, we also are thrilled to receive a variety of other contributions including:</p><ul dir="auto"><li><a href="https://github.com/webpack/webpack.js.org">Documentation</a> updates, enhancements, designs, or bugfixes</li><li>Spelling or grammar fixes</li><li>README.md corrections or redesigns</li><li>Adding unit, or functional tests</li><li>Triaging GitHub issues -- especially determining whether an issue still persists or is reproducible.</li><li><a href="https://twitter.com/search?q=webpack" rel="nofollow">Searching #webpack on twitter</a> and helping someone else who needs help</li><li>Teaching others how to contribute to one of the many webpack's repos!</li><li><a href="https://github.com/webpack-contrib/awesome-webpack">Blogging, speaking about, or creating tutorials</a> about one of webpack's many features.</li><li>Helping others in our webpack <a href="https://gitter.im/webpack/webpack" rel="nofollow">gitter channel</a>.</li></ul><p dir="auto">To get started have a look at our <a href="https://github.com/webpack/webpack/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md">documentation on contributing</a>.</p><p dir="auto">If you are worried or don't know where to start, you can <strong>always</strong> reach out to <a href="https://twitter.com/thelarkinn" rel="nofollow">Sean Larkin (@TheLarkInn) on Twitter</a> or simply submit an issue and a maintainer can help give you guidance!</p><p dir="auto">We have also started a series on our <a href="https://medium.com/webpack" rel="nofollow">Medium Publication</a> called <a href="https://medium.com/webpack/contributors-guide/home" rel="nofollow">The Contributor's Guide to webpack</a>. We welcome you to read it and post any questions or responses if you still need help.</p><p dir="auto"><em>Looking to speak about webpack?</em> We'd <strong>love</strong> to review your talk abstract/CFP! You can email it to webpack [at] opencollective [dot] com and we can give pointers or tips!!!</p><div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h3 align="center" tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">Creating your own plugins and loaders</h3><a id="user-content-creating-your-own-plugins-and-loaders" class="anchor-element" aria-label="Permalink: Creating your own plugins and loaders" href="#creating-your-own-plugins-and-loaders"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div><p dir="auto">If you create a loader or plugin, we would <3 for you to open source it, and put it on npm. We follow the <code>x-loader</code>, <code>x-webpack-plugin</code> naming convention.</p><div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h2 align="center" tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">Support</h2><a id="user-content-support" class="anchor-element" aria-label="Permalink: Support" href="#support"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div><p dir="auto">We consider webpack to be a low-level tool used not only individually but also layered beneath other awesome tools. Because of its flexibility, webpack isn't always the <em>easiest</em> entry-level solution, however we do believe it is the most powerful. That said, we're always looking for ways to improve and simplify the tool without compromising functionality. If you have any ideas on ways to accomplish this, we're all ears!</p><p dir="auto">If you're just getting started, take a look at <a href="https://webpack.js.org/concepts/" rel="nofollow">our new docs and concepts page</a>. This has a high level overview that is great for beginners!!</p><p dir="auto">Looking for webpack 1 docs? Please check out the old <a href="https://github.com/webpack/docs/wiki/contents">wiki</a>, but note that this deprecated version is no longer supported.</p><p dir="auto">If you want to discuss something or just need help, <a href="https://gitter.im/webpack/webpack" rel="nofollow">here is our Gitter room</a> where there are always individuals looking to help out!</p><p dir="auto">If you are still having difficulty, we would love for you to posta question to <a href="https://stackoverflow.com/tags/webpack" rel="nofollow">StackOverflow with the webpack tag</a>. It is much easier to answer questions that include your webpack.config.js and relevant files! So if you can provide them, we'd be extremely grateful (and more likely to help you find the answer!)</p><p dir="auto">If you are twitter savvy you can tweet #webpack with your question and someone should be able to reach out and help also.</p><p dir="auto">If you have discovered a 🐜 or have a feature suggestion, feel free to create an issue on Github.</p><div class="markdown-heading" It makes development and applications faster and it reduces the required bandwidth.</p><p dir="auto">This is how we use the donations:</p><ul dir="auto"><li>Allow the core team to work on webpack</li><li>Thank contributors if they invested a large amount of time in contributing</li><li>Support projects in the ecosystem that are of great value for users</li><li>Support projects that are href="https://github.com/google">@google</a> for <a href="http://www.gwtproject.org/" rel="nofollow">Google Web Toolkit (GWT)</a>, which aims to compile Java to JavaScript. It features a similar <a href="http://www.gwtproject.org/doc/latest/DevGuideCodeSplitting.html" rel="nofollow">Code Splitting</a> as webpack.</li><li><a href="https://github.com/medikoo">@medikoo</a> for <a href="https://github.com/medikoo/modules-webmake">modules-webmake</a>, which is a similar project. webpack was born because I wanted Code Splitting for modules-webmake. Interestingly the <a href="https://github.com/medikoo/modules-webmake/issues/7" data-hovercard-type="issue" data-hovercard-url="/medikoo/modules-webmake/issues/7/hovercard">Code Splitting issue is still open</a> (thanks also to @Phoscur for the discussion).</li><li><a href="https://github.com/substack">@substack</a> for <a href="https://browserify.org/" rel="nofollow">browserify</a>, which is a similar project and source for many ideas.</li><li><a href="https://github.com/jrburke">@jrburke</a> for <a href="https://requirejs.org/" rel="nofollow">require.js</a>, which is a similar project and source for many ideas.</li><li><a href="https://github.com/defunctzombie">@defunctzombie</a> for the <a href="https://github.com/defunctzombie/package-browser-field-spec">browser-field spec</a>, which makes modules available for node.js, browserify and webpack.</li><li>Every early webpack user, which contributed to webpack by writing issues or PRs. You influenced the direction...</li><li><a href="https://github.com/shama">@shama</a>, <a href="https://github.com/jhnns">@jhnns</a> and <a href="https://github.com/sokra">@sokra</a> for maintaining this project</li><li>Everyone who has written a loader for webpack.
